result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:13 PM Defendant Derek L Bates not in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared by video for Derek L Bates.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Sarbacker states that he was informed today that the defendant is in Dodge Correctional now.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset
Atty Sarbacker reach out to the JA to set up prison appearance.

10:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derek L Bates appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared by video for Derek L Bates. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties. Atty Sarbacker waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds time limits waived.  Set for status.  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derek L Bates appeared by video, in custody.  Also appearing is Attorney Rachel Roberge from the Public Defender's Office. 
1:10pm  Breakout room with Atty Roberge & defendant.  1:15pm  Breakout room closed.  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Juech requests $1,000 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Roberge makes statement and requests signature bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court orders $1000 cash bond with conditions.
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
